job_description: Data Science Support Analyst - Part-time/Temporary Role - job post Chicago Public Schools 1,766 reviews 42 W Madison St, Chicago, IL 60602 Part-time, Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Temporary Data Science Support Analyst - Part-time/Temporary Role Job Number: 230000E0 Posting Date : Mar 14, 2023, 2:11:02 PM Primary Location : Central-42 West Madison Street (Information & Technology Svcs) 35.00 Position Type : Non-Union Position Overtime Status : Non-exempt Final salary offers are dependent upon candidate qualifications. JOB DESCRIPTION - Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is one of the largest school districts in the United States, serving over 330,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning. The Office of Information and Technology Services (ITS) works to build the capacity of schools to use information and technology, maintain network infrastructure, security standards, and support other departments to meet district goals. ITS provides innovative technology solutions that improve the quality of education for students, reduce the administrative burden on educators, facilitate parent interaction, increase community engagement, and support CPS’ mission of transparency by focusing on the ease and equity of access to information. Job Summary: The focus of the Data Science Support Analyst, IT is to use data to drive progress towards District priority and goals. The analyst will accomplish this by providing sound data, analytical, survey, and project management expertise to Offices within the district and helping set district standards for data processes and toolsets for analytics This part-time/temporary position will be compensated for time worked on an hourly basis. The work schedule for this role will consist of an estimated 20 - 30 hours per week for an anticipated period of 4 months beginning 4/17/2023 and ending 8/31/2023. Due to the part-time/temporary nature of this work, this is not a benefit-eligible position. This role will report to the Data Science and Insights Team Lead. The part-time/temporary Data Science Support Analyst, IT will be held accountable for the following responsibilities: Support analytic project planning, design and implementation across a variety of topic areas Support other team members by fulfilling data requests, preparing data files, providing feedback on code, and collaborating on project methodology Compile, manipulate, and analyze data using appropriate statistical techniques to make recommendations and provide strategic planning for long term projects Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of business strategies using approved enterprise analytic toolsets (SAS or SQL) Collaborate with internal stakeholders at varying levels to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions Adhere to a set of guiding principles for analytic practice as established by the Data Governance Council Performs related duties as required In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Data Science Support Analyst, IT must possess the following qualifications: Education Required: A bachelor’s degree in education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or a related field including quantitative coursework A master’s degree in education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or a related field including quantitative coursework is preferred Experience Required: Minimum of three (3) years of professional experience in a role requiring data analysis and reporting skills Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Experience writing code with data analytic tools (SAS, R, Python, SPSS, Stata, etc.) and the ability to use or learn SAS required Proficiency in Relational Databases (SQL Server 2012 preferred) Experience drafting ad hoc surveys, programming content into online survey platforms (Alchemer, SurveyMonkey, Qualtrics, etc.), and presenting findings to stakeholders Exceptional organizational, communication (oral and written), and problem-solving skills Strong attention to detail and data quality assurance Ability to deliver in a fast-paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies and meet established deadlines Ability to work in a team, with technical and non-technical personnel, and across departmental boundaries Flexibility to meet changing departmental needs Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously Conditions of Employment As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to: Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. The Chicago residency requirement does not apply to temporary/part-time positions, however, all CPS employees must be residents of Illinois. Be Fully Vaccinated Against COVID-19 - Unless approved for a medical or religious exemption, all employees are required to be up-to-date on COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters, and to submit proof of vaccination to the district within 30 days of hire. “Up-to-date” on vaccination is defined as being at least two weeks past all primary vaccine doses and any applicable boosters.
